page.title: 11COMMON INSECTS IN FARR
page.content:
One of the most bothersome insects in this part of Scotland are the midges. They fly about in the evening and give you little bites.After a while these begin to itch.Once these have stopped itching they begin to get quite sore.
Another insect is the{ladybird.}The adult ladybird clings on to your finger if you pick it up,but a baby one just feels ticklish.Our gardeners like them as they eat pests.
The{honey bee}can make honey out of honeysuckle,heather,roses and all sorts of of flowers.One of my mum's friends has lots of bees and one of my next door neighbours has ten hives.
This year lots of{earwigs}have come into Strathnairn homes because it has been a lot wetter than usual.
